paragraphs.1: Decides to proclaim 11 July World Horse Day;
paragraphs.2: Invites all Member States, organizations of the United Nations system, other international and regional organizations and other relevant stakeholders, including civil society, the private sector and academia, as well as schools, to observe World Horse Day, in an appropriate manner and in accordance with national priorities, through activities aimed at raising awareness among the public of the economic and social importance of the horse and the equine industry, encouraging the development of professional training, scientific research, the dissemination of best practices in the equine sector, and the promotion of equine welfare, preserving horse culture and heritage, and sharing knowledge, information, best practices and other collaborative approaches in this regard;
paragraphs.3: Stresses that the cost of all activities that may arise from the implementation of the present resolution should be met by voluntary contributions and that such activities would be subject to the availability and provision of voluntary contributions;
paragraphs.4: Requests the Secretary-General to bring the present resolution to the attention of all Member States, the organizations of the United Nations system and other relevant stakeholders, including civil society, Indigenous Peoples, the private sector and academia, for appropriate observance.
